user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of OS_SocketSendTo_Impl:
```c
int32 OS_SocketSendTo_Impl(const OS_object_token_t *token, const void *buffer, size_t buflen,
                           const OS_SockAddr_t *RemoteAddr)
{
    int                             os_result;
    socklen_t                       addrlen;
    const struct sockaddr *         sa;
    OS_impl_file_internal_record_t *impl;

    impl = OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(OS_impl_filehandle_table, *token);

    sa = (const struct sockaddr *)&RemoteAddr->AddrData;
    switch (sa->sa_family)
    {
        case AF_INET:
            addrlen = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in);
            break;
#ifdef OS_NETWORK_SUPPORTS_IPV6
        case AF_INET6:
            addrlen = sizeof(struct sockaddr_in6);
            break;
#endif
        default:
            addrlen = 0;
            break;
    }

    if (addrlen != RemoteAddr->ActualLength)
    {
        return OS_ERR_BAD_ADDRESS;
    }

    os_result = sendto(impl->fd, buffer, buflen, MSG_DONTWAIT, sa, addrlen);
    if (os_result < 0)
    {
        OS_DEBUG("sendto: %s\n", strerror(errno));
        return OS_ERROR;
    }

    return os_result;
}
```
</target_code>
<additional code>Here are the definitions of symbols that are close to the target function OS_SocketSendTo_Impl:
#define OS_OBJECT_TABLE_GET(tbl, tok) (&tbl[OS_ObjectIndexFromToken(&(tok))])
...
extern OS_impl_file_internal_record_t OS_impl_filehandle_table[OS_MAX_NUM_OPEN_FILES]
...
typedef struct
{
    int  fd;
    bool selectable;
} OS_impl_file_internal_record_t
...
typedef struct OS_object_token OS_object_token_t
...
typedef struct
{
    size_t            ActualLength; /**< @brief Length of the actual address data */
    OS_SockAddrData_t AddrData;     /**< @brief Abstract Address data */
} OS_SockAddr_t
...
#define OS_NETWORK_SUPPORTS_IPV6 
...
#define OS_ERR_BAD_ADDRESS (-34)
...
#define OS_ERROR (-1)
...
#define OS_DEBUG(__VA_ARGS__) 
</additional code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
    if (addrlen != RemoteAddr->ActualLength)
    {
        return OS_ERR_BAD_ADDRESS;
    }
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: Not violated. The comparison and conditional return are reachable at runtime: addrlen is set by the preceding switch (AF_INET/AF_INET6/default), and RemoteAddr->ActualLength is runtime input. For example, if sa->sa_family==AF_INET and RemoteAddr->ActualLength != sizeof(struct sockaddr_in) the function will take the return path; if sa->sa_family is not one of the handled families addrlen is set to 0 and will typically trigger the return. There is no path that makes this fragment statically unreachable.
